title: Want To Buy:  Private collector wants Anything Cool or Different
postcontent:
I am looking to enhance my personal collection with unique items that may or may not be found easily.  Handguns, shotguns, rifles etc.  I especially like .22 caliber guns and accessories and anything in the AR-15/m4 family but really I'm looking for some fun new toys and I'm tired of buying brand new. 

That being said I am NOT looking to buy "Used" stuff for "New" prices so Please don't email me to sell me something I can otherwise buy new for a few bucks more!  It drives me nuts when I see something that retails for $500 being sold for $425!  I WILL PAY MORE than any dealer or pawn broker because it is for me personally but be realistic please!

I prefer Face-To-Face transactions with Va licensees and Signed Bill of sale but if necessary I will consider FFL to FFL 

I will not risk my job my family my freedom or my morals for my hobby so do not attempt to fray the threads of my moral fabric with shady or illegal propositions as I am not interested!

I am a member of three NOVA area shooting ranges If you prefer to meet there I am ok with that.

postcontent:
I have a couple guns/uppers that need a new home, the 243LBC was shot less the 30 times, Worked up a 95 gr Berger load during deer season and took it hunting, Its shot the Bergers Great and i was able to kill a deer at 411 yds with it. The 22 LBC has been shot less than 15 times. So both are like new and the DPMS lower is New, i ordered it after deer season with the Magpul on it and it has been sitting in safe every since. 

24 inch 1in9 twist 243 LBC Blackhole Weaponry Match grade barrel (Black Satin Finish) 
Zeiss 6x20x50 Z plex 
Larue Tacical SPR quick detach mount 
Flip up Scope covers
DPMS Railed GB 
YHM GT 
Model 1 sale Vented FFT

24 inch 22 LBC Blackhole Weaponry Match Grade Barrel (Black Satin Finish) 
Blackhole Protrietary Railed Upper/BCG 
Model 1 sales FFT 
DPMS Railed GB 
YHM GT 

I would like to sale both these together, but might sale apart. The only way i can sell apart is to sale the 243LBC without BCG, 
Since BCG has to go with the Railed upper. But you can use the Railed BCG in any type Upper, But You can ONLY use the Railed BCG in the Railed upper. 

The 243 LBC is basically a 6mmAR the guy at BHW that had Dave Kiff build the reamer made him build it to a Spec where we can load it with 6PPC dies, So its very simple and cheap to load for Just One pass through the PPC dies and barely pump the shoulder of the 6.5 Grendel brass and you good to go, The 22 LBC is set up the same just have to run it through the 6ppc and then the 22ppc. 

I will sale everything with both set of dies. $1950 TYD 
Just the 243 lbc and Scope and Mount $1400

title: For Sale:  1930's Stevens 520 12ga
postcontent:
Description: 

Grampa's very good condition, all original 1930's 520 12ga takedown. This is the more "expensive" model from the 1930's ("Boy, she's a beauty!" See: http://www.searsarchives.com/products/questions/firearms/detail/firearms_1933.htm) with the raised matted rib.  Marked "Browning Patent" on the barrel.  Diamond pattern on stock and forestock. 

Condition:  

A few dings and scratches on stock, a little finish wear. No cracks or separations on stock or forestock.  Bluing is 90-95% with a normal wear along sharper edges and tiny spot of rust on the outer receiver above trigger.  One small scratch on outer barrel.  Inner barrel is clean and shiny, no rust.  Action is smooth. 

Canvas bag, on the other, has seen better days - threads and leather have dried out and ends are worn open but could be sewn.  

Included is the original oak cleaning rod with wire brush and rag attachments. 

Grampa passed away more than 25 years ago.  I have never fired this gun (his Winchester 24 16ga double barrel, a different story).  I cannot say when the last time it was used.  Three different gun shops have given the "OK to Fire" but this 80-year old shotgun cannot be used for water fowl... no steel shot allowed.  

Please contact me with any questions.  Wisconsin residents only, please

title: For Sale:  MSAR STG 556 for only $1200
location: Broomfield --- Denver Metro Area, Denver, Colorado
postcontent:
The MSAR STG 556 rifle is one of the newest rifles on the market, but new only in the USA civilian market, due to the import restrictions of the Steyr Aug, which originally was manufactured in early 1970s. Like most military innovations the civilian market would finally have their chance to get their hands on these reliable firearms. The MSAR 556 STG also known as the Microtech Small Arms Research 5.56 brings the Bullpup design to the civilian market. Over the past decade a great number of other firearms companies attempted to make Bullpup rifles, which for the most part ended up as complete failures. 

The Bullpup design is typically when the trigger mechanism is closer to the muzzle that the firearm’s receiver, which allows for faster point and shot techniques. This innovation leads to higher precision due to the length of the barrel, and more accurate fit in the user’s body. The MSAR STG 556 rifle uses almost identical specs as the Steyr Aug, although MSAR STG 556 has released information which states the design was Steyr Aug's with their own innovation. 

Taking a closer look at the operating design would lead most to believe the MSAR STG 556 is a Steyr Aug clone. The Steyr Aug like the SSG-556 rifles works on the gas piston blow back principal, evident in most modern firearms of our era, and have a handful of new features. We are proud to offer a wide selection of STG 556 rifles for the civilian markets, as well as accessories for SSG-556 rifles. The SSG-556 rifle also uses a great amount of innovations from other rifles like the m16 style rifles, such as the bolt forward assist. 
The changes to note from the Steyr Aug to the STG 556; bolt forward assist, three position safety, visible from all angles, ability to use left handed bolt, bolt catch for fast reloads. The STG 556 was redesigned from the ground up in the USA, by Microtech Small Arms Research. We are proud to carry a wide range of MSAR products, including the STG-556 rifle.

I have less than 100 rounds through this rifle. If you check out other websites you'll find that lowest price on these rifles is around $1600.00 bucks. This rifle comes with 3 magazines. 

If interested please call me at REDACTED or email me at REDACTED.



Operating System	Gas Delayed Semi-Automatic Rotating Bolt (Bull Pup)
Barrel Group	Fast Interchangeable
Overall Length	27 Inches (With 16" Barrel)
Overall Height	11 Inches
Trigger	Pull-through trigger system

title: For Sale:  ww2 silver wound badge
postcontent:
The Silver grade was produced initially from silver-plated brass, and later in the war (1942) from whitewashed zinc. The reverse was solid, with either a needle or fat bellied pin and the manufacturers and silver content marks, if present. Awarded for three or four wounds, it could also be awarded for more serious wounds if such wound included loss of hearing, a hand, a foot, an eye, brain damage, or facial disfigurement.


 verwundetenabzeichen silber #26 bh mayer

postcontent: 7.62x54r custom flash hider and 100 round silver bear 203 grain softpoint ammo. title: For Sale:  Intratec Cat 9 Semi-auto
postcontent:
Inexpensive 9mm semi-auto.  Mag holds 7.  Small, lightweight, ideal for concealing.   Some people will deride the quality of this piece.  However, I got it from a relative after it had sat for years.   It was balky at first due to sitting so long but cleaning, polishing the ramp, feed and slide it now fires, ejects and loads reliably.  I've put several hundred rounds through it without a single jam.

It has no sights, safety or other go-gas to catch on clothing, making it easy to conceal.  I would not consider it a target gun.  Rather it's best suited for close range personal protection.  We can go to my rod and gun club and you can check it out.  

Included is a somewhat rough plastic case and a manual showing how to disassemble. (very easy to take apart).  Due to my fat fingers, I did rework the trigger to smooth the tip which rubbed.  

I will not sell this unless you have the proper paperwork which can be obtained from your local government authority.  If you have a CPL as I do, the transaction is easier.

title: For Sale:  Stainless - Interarms AMT Backup .380 ACP
postcontent:
This is a stainless model Interarms AMT Backup .380 ACP (9mm Kurz) semi-auto.  This was my Grandfather’s gun and is in great condition.  I am selling it with the factory 5-round magazine, a right-hand belt-slide holster, and a box of ammo (can’t remember what brand/grain or how many rounds – please ask if it’s important to you and I will check). 

This is a great concealed carry handgun and has always functioned perfectly for me.  It has a 2.5” barrel so its small size makes it easy to conceal – a true “pocket pistol.”  I’ve shot a variety of different ammunition and all has functioned reliably. The single action trigger makes shooting clean groups at 10 yards fairly easy. Not a target pistol, but it will certainly fit the bill as a defensive piece.

This pistol was designed to be carried as a backup gun by law enforcement and security professionals or anyone desiring a small concealable weapon. Its marketing slogan was "the smallest, most powerful" backup weapon available.

$275 cash OBO.  Must meet face to face in the Eugene area. Must have a valid ODL and willing to sign bill of sale.

title: For Sale:  Mossberg 935 Turkey 12 gauge Auto Pistol Grip
postcontent:
I have a Mossberg 935 turkey gun. You could use this for any other bird hunting or trap however the barrell is short at 24" allowing you to move more easily while sitting in your blind. Gun also has a turkey stock which makes shooting from a sitting or crouched position much easier. Included is a genuine Mossberg Turkey choke and custom open style red dot sight allowing you to simply put the dot on target and fire - both eyes open. 

This gun patterns very well. The 935 is arguably the best turkey gun made as the chamber is overbored allowing more compression of loads which translates into tighter patterns. This gun is an automatic and can handle 3.5" shells no problem. 

Perfect gun for the person looking to get into turkey hunting or the expierienced hunter. It is all set and ready to go. Selling because I need space in the gun safe and I really dont turkey hunt anymore. you can call me at nine two zero four one nine eight zero zero three.

title: For Sale:  JPoint Red Dot
postcontent:
It's been sitting in my closet too long, so it's time to go. 3.5 MOA dot on a Weaver mount, comes with the cover. If you don't know about JPoint-type sights, they automatically adjust dot brightness to ambient light levels. The cover keeps the battery from wearing down when not in use. It still illuminates after years in the closet but you'll probably want a fresh battery.

Caveat: I don't know about it's zero. I had it on an 870 using the pictured mount and the zero was considerably higher than the POI. I don't know if it's the sight, the rail mount or the saddle mount it was attached to. I solved the problem by wedging the back of the sight up a bit. You may wish to take the wedge out before you try it yourself, I never tried it on another gun or mount. Please note that the Aimtech shotgun rail pictured is NOT included!

It has the 4 inch barrel, but the full size grips. That's why it is such a high capacity gun for a 45. Both guns are clean and have less than 100 rounds through them. title: For Sale:  HK P7 PSP 9mm Heckler & Koch Squeeze Cocker
postcontent: I am selling my Heckler & Koch P7 PSP 9mm.  This is HK's squeeze cocker model where the grip must be squeezed to cock the firing pin.  Very cool and unique design.  This gun is no longer being imported.  This is the predecessor to the M8 and M13.  It has a fixed barrel and it is extremely accurate and in a very small package, great for concealed carry.  It has no levers or anything to get snagged on a holster.  It is a very clean design.  This gun comes with its original case, original magazine, original takedown tool and original owners manual.  It also comes with an additional HK OEM magazine that was purchased new for $70 from HK.  The gun is in great condition only showing a bit of wear on the blueing, otherwise is perfect mechanically and the barrel is bright, shiney and spotless.  It shoots and functions flawlessly.  I hate to sell it but I just need the money for other projects.  I'll make it easy so there is no haggling over price, the price is $700 cash and I am firm on the price.  I am not interested in trades at this time.  If interested, email me and I will get back to you ASAP.  Thanks!

title: For Sale/Trade:  FireStar M40 (.40cal) Starvel Finnish +accesories
location: Stuart/Jensen Beach, Palm Beach, South Florida
postcontent: Good/Fair - This is an old gun, that was imported by Inter Arms. This firearm was designed in Spain for a military officer sidearm. It actually has the military creed symbol stamped into the magazine slot. It somewhat resembles a miniature 1911 style handgun. Although fairly heavy due to the solid steel structure, i used this as an everyday carry for almost a whole year. This gun fires with precision and is extremely accurate. I have maintained it well since my original purchase. I got it with some tarnish however, being in the jewelry industry, i striped the gun down to bare and put it in the ultrasonic cleaner. I replaced the firing pin and other municipals which are hard to find nowadays. Having the ability to custom design at my family establishment, we can also manufacture parts down the road if necessary. The gun also has a magazine safety where that if so happen the gun was charged and the magazine was not inserted, it still is not capable of firing. Continuing on, This gun is immaculate other than a slight oil fill on the gripping from the webbing of your hand. It has become part of the steel. Since ownership i believe i have shot around 200-300 rounds through it. I have never had any major issues but maybe a slight jam here and there because i didn't clean the dirty ejector after use. This is a future collectible, for those who collect, im just ready to move on to a new toy.

Okay, I found something I like so I am going to let this go for a steal.  The price is not negotiable.  I can buy the other gun without having to sell this one but really need to thin out the collection.

This is a Beretta 92C L Type (Double stack) in EXCELLENT condition in the original blue box with 2 13 round mags.  This will round out your collection or you can re-sell it and make a few bucks.

These are no longer imported.  A small run was available a couple years ago and had the ugly safety message stamped in the slide.

This is ITALIAN MADE and the S/N dates to the begining of production (first year if I'm not mistaken) in the early 90's.  It is already hard to find but in this condition, it is downright scarce.

I am going to include two brand new holsters.  One is a USGI holster in the package and the other is a desert tan drop leg.  Neither have ever been used and I have never shot the gun.  Pics available for a serious buyer.

I will take paypal in the form of a gift to avoid the 3% fee or cash if FTF.  I would rather do a FTF transaction with bill of sale to legal NH residents but I will ship at the buyers expense to an FFL.

You will not find a better deal on this gun.  If sold (payment is received) by the weekend, I will throw in a nice surprise - 3 brand new hi cap mags for your full size 92 or 5 used GI AR 30 rnd mags - your choice!!

That's it guys.  The good deals on A list are few and far between.  I'm not rude, I return emails, I'm honest, and I'm not trying to get a million dollars for a $100 gun.

No trades on this please.  Just a great gun and accessories at an unbeatable price.

All the pics are of the actual gun - no internet photos.

postcontent:
BUYING A GUN ONLINE?
BUYING FROM AN OUT OF STATE PERSON/DEALER?
BUYING FROM AN AUCTION SITE?


FIREARM TRANSFERS - How do they work?

A.	Please contact MTC Gun by email or telephone and tell us about your purchase. We will send a copy of our Federal Firearms License (FFL) to the seller of the firearm. 
B.	YOU  make payment to the seller of the firearm.
C.	When the seller receives your payment and the copy of our FFL, the seller will ship the firearm(s) to MTC Gun .
D.	When the firearm arrives, MTC Gun will notify you and set up an appointment to transfer the firearm(s) to you.
E.	MTC Gun will complete the required state and federal documents and the required background check to complete the transfer. 
MTC Gun has to follow all state and federal laws. If you do not pass the background check you cannot take possession of the firearm.

TRANSFER PRICING:
$20.00 for your first inbound transfer to us. After that, your next 3 are $15. Your 5th transfer is FREE! We reward our repeat customers.


Check us on galleryofguns.com to see items we can order for you:

  http://www.davidsonsinc.com/consumers/subsites/dealer_home.asp?dealer_id=70127



Thanks, Let me know if I can help you out.



Mike

MTC Gun

title: For Sale/Trade:  Taurus 24/7 Pro 4" (.45ACP)
postcontent:
Lightly used (<500rnds) Taurus 24/7 Pro in .45ACP w/ 4" barrel. One owner, purchased new Feb 2011. Comes with both factory magazines- one 10+1, one 12 w/extension, factory 'Taurus Security System' key(s), one N82 Tactical holster (left handed), and factory box w/ owner's guide & bore brush.

Nothing wrong with this gun- I bought it new and carried it for about 5 months before deciding that this gun just really isn't for me; I like longer barrels, and either SAO OR DAO. I have cleaned this gun within 24 hours of every trip to the range.

If you're not familiar with these guns, it is a polymer frame, DA/SA striker fired, 'compact' .45ACP handgun. Has a red indicator on the back of the slide to indicate whether weapon is 'cocked', and a loaded chamber indicator on the slide just under the ejection port- which is also the extractor. Also, magazine release can be switched from left side to right side of frame. The safety also doubles as the de-cocker. This handgun also has the required 'drop safety', but DOES NOT have a 'magazine safety', meaning that the weapon CAN be fired WITHOUT a magazine inserted.

Do not have pictures at the moment, please email if interested and I can respond with pictures.

title: For Sale:  Remington .244 (6mm) Rifle
postcontent:
The scope on the gun is a Tasco 3-9X40 , and i am looking to sell it because i need money for school and its a right handed gun and i am a lefty. It is a smooth shooting gun, has a pretty stock, and i believe it would make a fine addition to any gun collectors collection. I am asking 350 obo. I am available for call or text anytime, the number 1479-three01-0733  

I am not entirely sure what year the gun was made, but here is a little history behind the .244 Remington. As you may know, Remington introduced the .244 in 1955 (the same year Winchester introduced the .243). Remington misread the market and introduced their .244 caliber with a 1:12 twist designed to stabilize light varmint bullets whereas Winchester introduced their .243 with a 1:9 twist which proved more suitable for stabilizing the larger dual purpose (deer/varmint) bullets. The .243 dominated the market but Remington quickly learned from their mistake and began rebarreling in a slower twist as of 1958. By then, however, the damage had been done and sales of the .244 continued to suffer. In 1963 they pulled the rifle and reintroduced it as the 6mm Remington and the rest is history. 

The barrel is stamped "Flaig Ace." After a great deal of research I believe the rifle was likely built by or at least built on an Edwin Flaig barreled action. Flaig was an eccentric German-American from Millvale, PA. His rifles were reported to have been of excellent quality and there is some interesting information about him and his self proclaimed role in WWII. Without boring you to death suffice it to say that the rifle is in very good condition. It shoots well and is pleasant to carry. 

Additional photos available upon request
